definition: to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
surname Yu
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
bead/pearl/CL:粒[li4],顆|颗[ke1]

sentences.english: They resorted to the trick of passing off fish-eyes as pearls.
sentences.chinese: 他們使用了魚目混珠的伎倆。

sentences.english: The peddler fobbed off pieces of glass as diamonds.
sentences.chinese: 這小販魚目混珠，以玻璃充當鑽石騙人。

sentences.english: These facts prove that they are trying to pass fish eyes for pearls.
sentences.chinese: 這些事實證明他們是在打算魚目混珠。

definition: making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to invert right and wrong
ill-gotten wealth or gains
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
dissident/dissenting/dissent
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to become a mere formality
to behead
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
